title: Daniel Aguillón
text:
Daniel Aguillón Ramírez (August 11, 1984 – October 18, 2008) was a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> <a href="featherweight">featherweight</a> <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. He died in a <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> hospital after a five-day coma induced by a knockout punch by fellow Mexican boxer Alejandro Sanabria during an official fight held on October 15, 2008 in <a href="Polanco%20%28Mexico%29">Polanco</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. He was 24.
Death.
Aguillón (16–4–2, 9 KOs) was punched in the jaw in the last minute of the 12th round of the super featherweight bout for the Central American title, sanctioned by the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">World Boxing Council</a> (WBC) by his opponent Sanabria, he fell unconscious on the floor and was taken to a hospital, but never recovered. The WBC announced it will provide financial support for the family.
